title: Senate passes aid, public broadcasting cuts | The Excerpt
shortDescription: Plus: New Trump policy that will keep immigration detainees locked up longer. | Listen to these and more stories on The Excerpt.

title: White House revokes $4B in funding for California's high-speed rail
shortDescription: The Trump administration has officially revoked federal funding for California's high-speed rail project.

title: Poll: Trump's immigration approval rating at an all time low
shortDescription: President Donald Trump’s approval rating on immigration is at an all time low since the start of his second term, according to a new poll.

title: Democrats storm out over Republican vote to advance Trump court pick
shortDescription: Democrats stormed out of a Senate committee meeting after Republicans pushed Trump judicial pick Emil Bove forward for a federal appeals court seat.

title: Trump tumbles in new Jeffrey Epstein poll
shortDescription: Republicans are evenly split as the White House copes with MAGA demands for more disclosures from the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking case.

title: Trump pick Jeanine Pirro moves closer to full D.C. U.S. attorney role
shortDescription: Ex-Fox News host Jeanine Pirro moved closer July 17 to taking on a long-term role as the top federal prosecutor for the nation's capital.

title: These Republicans have called for more transparency on Epstein files
shortDescription: President Donald Trump called his 'past supporters,' 'weaklings' over their calls for more transparency over the Jeffrey Epstein files, like MTG.

title: Trump fires daughter of ex-FBI chief and prosecutor against Epstein
shortDescription: New York federal prosecutor Maurene Comey, who worked on the cases against Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and Sean "Diddy" Combs, was fired.

title: Trump pushes Coca-Cola's switch to cane sugar
shortDescription: President Donald Trump says Coca-Cola agreed to start using cane sugar in their U.S. beverages, similar to the recipes used in other countries.

title: Senate votes to cut funding to PBS, NPR
shortDescription: The bill to cut more than $9 billion from public broadcasting, foreign aid and more will move on for a final House vote, then to the president.

title: Activists will channel civil rights icon in anti-Trump day of action
shortDescription: Anti-Trump protests, channeling the legacy of Rep. John Lewis, are calling for 'good trouble.'

title: ¿Qué es “Good Trouble Lives On”? ¿Por qué hay protestas contra Trump?
shortDescription: Miles marcharán este 17 de julio en EE. UU. contra Trump y en honor a John Lewis. “Good Trouble Lives On” exige justicia y protección de los derechos civiles.

title: Senate passes $9 billion spending cuts: Which programs are impacted?
shortDescription: Two Republican senators voted no in the early hours of July 17. The legislation returns to the House for approval ahead of a Friday deadline.

title: Mike Pence urges Trump to 'release all the files' on Jeffrey Epstein
shortDescription: Former Vice President Mike Pence is urging the Trump administration to release all of the files on convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Tina Smith hospitalized, likely to miss vote on Trump's spending cuts
shortDescription: The Minnesota Democrat 'started to not feel well' during the day and will stay the night at a Washington hospital, her staff said.

title: Top Biden aide refuses to talk in GOP 'autopen' investigation
shortDescription: Anthony Bernal is the second person Biden staffer to assert their Fifth Amendment right to the GOP-led House Oversight Committee.

title: Trump signs bill to keep tough fentanyl penalties
shortDescription: President Donald Trump signed a bill ensuring mandatory minimum sentences remain in place for fentanyl trafficking.

title: Trump administration works to sell signature law amid polling concerns
shortDescription: Trump's legislation narrowly cleared Congress. Now the administration is facing the challenge of selling it to the public.

title: Trump signs bill solidifying tough sentences for fentanyl traffickers
shortDescription: Trump signed a bill to keep stiff sentences for fentanyl trafficking, among the most serious crimes the Drug Enforcement Administration investigates.
